Question: In 1963, Dick James established Northern Songs to publish the songs of Lennon–this person.
Hints: This person wanted the tour to avoid large venues; most of the small halls they played had capacities of fewer than 3,000 people.
This person played bass on "Peace Dream", and sang a duet with Starr on "Walk with You.
This person initially owned 20% of Northern Songs, which became 15% after a public stock offering in 1965.
